column4: My disk has been partitioning for over 1:30 hours and i'm worried it's frozen or something... should i quit or wait?
My hard drive activity light isn't blinking
well if you touch it, can you feel it seeking?
what kind of drive is it?
this is in the ubuntu install that you get stuck on partitioning?

maybe you should kill it and try to come up in the livecd environment.  if it (ubuntu) is gonna be compatible with your hardware, maybe you can try partitioning and formatting from the live install session to see if it works there
what options did you choose for partitioning?  is it resizing a windows partition?
that can take a long time
if it is resizing and you kill it, be aware that you may lose that partiton and all the data.  just be forewarned that it is not at all considered a safe thing to do
that is up to you and your patience weighted against how much you value the existing data and whether reinstalling it all from scratch is a viable option for you (in case the worst happens)
to be honest though, resizing in the first place is always to be considered a risky maneuver and should never be done to a partition with critical data (until you've backed it up)
partitioning can be quite fast.. resizing involves shuffling data
then well maybe it is b0rked after all.
i mean the resize operation.. it could be that it has been sitting there doing nothing, and your data *could* be just fine.  no guarantees.
well like i said, it is up to you and your patience versus your willingness to deal with outcomes
if you are fed up waiting and have no faith it's doing anything (no lights, no noticable seeks), then well maybe you are at that point of cancelling
